bibl.title: Telegram from Arthur W. Packard to Philip Showalter Hench, November 12, 1947

div1.p: Packard informs Hench that the Rockefeller Foundation will not provide financial support for the Camp Lazear memorial. As such, he believes a meeting with Hench is unnecessary.

div1.head: Telegram from Arthur W. Packard to Philip Showalter Hench, November 12, 1947
div1.opener:
CLASS OF SERVICE
----
This is a full-rate
Telegram or Cable-
gram unless its de-
ferred character is in-
dicated by a suitable
symbol above or pre-
ceding the address.
1220
(42·)
__________________________________________________
WESTERN
UNION
JOSEPH L. EGAN
PRESIDENT
The filling time shown in the date line on telegrams and day letters is STANDARD TIME at point of origin. Time of receipt is STANDARD TIME at point of destination
MV 190 DL PD=WUX NEW YORK NY 12 1259 P
1947 NOV 12 PM 12 42
DR PHILIP HENCH= MAYO CLINIC
div1.p:
YOUR LETTER PROVIDED THOROUGHLY ADEQUATE MATERIAL
FOR PRELIMINARY CONSIDERATION WHICH INDICATES NO
LIKELIHOOD OUR FINANCIAL PARTICIPATION. YOUR POINTS
FULLY APPRECIATED. DECISION INVOLVES PRINCIPLES
NECESSARILY LIMITING SCOPE NATURE OUR COMMITMENTS.
BELIEVE THEREFORE CONFERENCE NOT HELPFULLY SERVE YOUR
PURPOSE NOR WARRANT SPECIAL NEW YORK VISIT. IF IN
LIGHT OF ABOVE YOU CARE TO CALL SHALL BE GLAD TO SEE
YOU ON EITHER 18TH OR 20TH. WRITING=
div1.closer:
ARTHUR W PACKARD ROOM 5600 30
ROCKEFELLER PLAZA.
300, PM
18 20 5600 30.
THE COMPANY WILL APPRECIATE SUGGESTIONS FROM ITS PATRONS CONCERNING ITS SERVICE
